columns.person_id: A unique identifier assigned to each individual in the database.
columns.first_name: The first name of the individual.
columns.middle_name: The middle name of the individual, if applicable.
columns.last_name: The last name or surname of the individual.
columns.email_address: The email address of the individual.
columns.login_name: A unique username chosen by the individual for logging into systems.
columns.password: The password associated with the login name for secure access.

People.table_description: The People table stores personal information about individuals, including their names, contact details, and credentials for system access.

columns.address_id: A unique identifier for each address record.
columns.line_1: The primary line of the address, typically containing the building number and street name.
columns.line_2: An optional second line for the address, often used for apartment or suite numbers.
columns.city: The name of the city where the address is located.
columns.zip_postcode: The postal code assigned for the address, used for sorting and delivering mail.
columns.state_province_county: The name of the state, province, or county associated with the address.
columns.country: The name of the country where the address is situated.

Addresses.table_description: The Addresses table stores detailed information about locations related to individuals, including unique identifiers and comprehensive address components.

columns.course_id: A unique identifier assigned to each course, used to distinguish one course from another.
columns.course_name: The title of the course, providing an overview of the subject being taught.
columns.course_description: A brief overview that outlines the course content and what students can expect to learn.
columns.other_details: Additional information regarding the course that may include prerequisites, grading policy, or other relevant notes.

Courses.table_description: The Courses table holds information about various academic courses offered, including identification, title, description, and supplementary details.

columns.person_address_id: Identifies a unique record of the relationship between a person and their address.
columns.person_id: References a unique identifier for the person associated with the address.
columns.address_id: References a unique identifier for the address linked to the person.
columns.date_from: Indicates the start date of the person's association with the address.
columns.date_to: Indicates the end date of the person's association with the address.

People_Addresses.table_description: The People_Addresses table maintains a record of the addresses associated with individuals, tracking the duration of their residence at each address.

columns.student_id: A unique identifier for each student enrolled in a course.
columns.course_id: A unique identifier for each course that a student can register for.
columns.registration_date: The date and time when a student registered for a specific course.

Student_Course_Registrations.table_description: The Student_Course_Registrations table tracks the relationships between students and the courses they are enrolled in, along with the date of their registration.

columns.student_id: A unique identifier for each student in the database, used to distinguish students from one another.
columns.student_details: Additional information about the student, which may include their name or other relevant personal details.

Students.table_description: The Students table stores essential information about each student, identified by a unique student ID and supplemented by specific details about the student.

columns.student_id: This column represents the unique identifier for a student enrolled in a course.
columns.course_id: This column signifies the unique identifier of the course in which the student is attending.
columns.date_of_attendance: This column captures the date and time when the student attended the specified course.

Student_Course_Attendance.table_description: The Student_Course_Attendance table records the attendance of students for various courses, using the student and course identifiers along with the date of attendance.

columns.candidate_id: A unique identifier assigned to each candidate in the database.
columns.candidate_details: Contains information about the candidate, typically their name.

Candidates.table_description: The Candidates table stores essential information about individuals participating in assessments.

columns.candidate_id: The unique identifier for each candidate being assessed.
columns.qualification: Indicates the qualification level achieved by the candidate.
columns.assessment_date: The date and time when the assessment was conducted.
columns.asessment_outcome_code: The result of the assessment, indicating whether the candidate passed or failed.

Candidate_Assessments.table_description: The Candidate_Assessments table stores assessment records for candidates, including their qualifications, assessment dates, and outcomes.
